title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
Saudi Arabia took steps to boost oil output and extend a truce with Iran-backed forces in Yemen, two significant moves that help pave the way for Biden to visit the kingdom later this month as the two countries try to reset their strained relationship.

---

Microsoft cut its sales and earnings guidance for the current quarter, citing the impact of foreign-exchange rates as the stronger U.S. dollar takes a toll.

---

Kohl's received takeover bids from private-equity firm Sycamore and from Franchise Group, according to people familiar with the matter.

---

The Fed's Brainard said she supported plans to raise interest rates by a half-percentage point at a meeting later this month and again in July, and batted down speculation that the central bank would pause after that.

---

Major U.S. stock indexes climbed, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow industrials posting gains of 1.8%, 2.7% and 1.3%, respectively.

---

Ford plans to add thousands of manufacturing jobs to its factories in Michigan, Ohio and Missouri, as it looks to expand vehicle output and prepare for labor talks.

---

401(k) provider ForUsAll sued the Labor Department, seeking to invalidate agency guidance that says companies that offer cryptocurrencies in retirement plans should expect to be investigated.

---

Tiger Global told investors that losses at its high-profile hedge fund ballooned to 52% through May.
